uk.ac.cam.darknet.common

Class Properties

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.cam.darknet.common.Properties

  • public class Properties
extends java.lang.Object
    This class stores an individual's attributes as a set of key-value pairs. Keys are always strings, but values must be of the type specified by the attribute category that the attribute falls into. This class also takes the attribute's reliability as a parameter when one is added. It always returns an AttributeReliabilityPair, which can be used to retrieve both the attribute and its reliability. Note that attributes are type checked using the global attribute table when being added. However, client code should cast retrieved attributes as they have to be returned as Object.
    Author:
    Ibtehaj Nadeem

    • Constructor Detail

      • Properties

        public Properties(java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,AttributeCategories> globalAttributeTable)
        Constructs a new Properties object with the given attribute table. This object will only allow those keys to be added which are also present in the provided global table. It will also enforce the corresponding value to be of the correct type, as determined by the category of each attribute.
        Parameters:
        globalAttributeTable - The global table mapping all available attribute names to their global attribute types.

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public void put(java.lang.String key,
       java.lang.Object value,
       double reliability)
         throws UnknownAttributeException,
                InvalidAttributeTypeException,
                InvalidReliabilityException
        This method adds an attribute to this Properties object. The key must be a valid attribute present in this object's global attribute table. If this is not the case, an UnknownAttributeException will be thrown. If the type of the object is not as specified by the attribute category, an InvalidAttributeType exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        key - The name of the attribute to add.
        value - The corresponding object.
        reliability - The reliability of the attribute. This must be a number between 0.0 (no confidence) and 1.0 (complete certainty).
        Throws:
        UnknownAttributeException
        InvalidAttributeTypeException
        InvalidReliabilityException

      • get

        public AttributeReliabilityPair get(java.lang.String key)
        The value to which the specified attribute name is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the attribute.
        Parameters:
        key - The attribute name whose associated value is to be returned.
        Returns:
        The value to which the specified attribute name is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the attribute.

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.String key)
        Removes the key-value pair specified by the given key from this Properties object. This method does nothing if the key is not in the object.
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the key-value pair to remove.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears this Properties object so that it contains no more key-value pairs.

      • containsAttribute

        public boolean containsAttribute(java.lang.String key)
        Tests whether a given attribute is contained in this Properties object.
        Parameters:
        key - The name of the attribute whose presence should be checked.
        Returns:
        True if the key is contained, false otherwise.
